      the format used (default, .gpkg)

    • mergeFiles

      public static java.io.File mergeFiles​(java.util.List<java.io.File> file2MergeIn, java.io.File fileOut) throws java.io.IOException
      Merge geofiles. They must be of the same type, Geopackage (.gpkg) or Shapefile (.shp). Try to keep attributes.
      Parameters:
      file2MergeIn - List of geofiles to merge
      fileOut - Where to write the merged File
      Returns:
      the merged File
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Reading and writing

    • mergeFiles

      public static java.io.File mergeFiles​(java.util.List<java.io.File> file2MergeIn, java.io.File fileOut, java.io.File boundFile, boolean keepAttributes) throws java.io.IOException
      Merge geofiles. They must be of the same type, Geopackage (.gpkg) or Shapefile (.shp). Try to keep attributes.
      Parameters:
      file2MergeIn - List of geofiles to merge
      fileOut - Where to write the merged File
      boundFile - apply a mask on the result
      keepAttributes - keep every attribute. Must be the same schema between every files.
      Returns:
      the merged File
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Reading, writing, or unknown extension

    • isSimpleFeatureContainsAttribute

      public static boolean isSimpleFeatureContainsAttribute​(org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature feat, java.lang.String attributeFiledName)
      Check if the given Simple Feature contains the given field name. Uses the Schemas.isSchemaContainsAttribute method.
      Parameters:
      feat - input feature
      attributeFiledName - name of the field (must respect case)
      Returns:
      true if the feature contains the field name, false otherwise

      public static org.geotools.data.DataStore getDataStore​(java.io.File f) throws java.io.IOException
      get the corresponding Data Store looking the file's attribute
      Parameters:
      f - input geographic file. Must either be a geopackage (.gpkg), a shapefile (.shp), or a geojson (.json or .geojson)
      Returns:
      The corresponding DataStore
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the file's not found or contains a wrong extension

      Parameters:
      toExport - collection to export

    • exportSFC

    • exportSFC

      public static java.io.File exportSFC​(org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection toExport, java.io.File fileOut, org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeatureType ft, java.lang.String outputType, boolean overwrite) throws java.io.IOException
      Export a simple feature collection. If the geo file already exists, either overwrite it or merge it with the existing feature collection.
      Parameters:
      toExport - Collection to export
      fileOut - file name and path where to write
      ft - schema of the collection
      outputType - type of geo file to write
      overwrite - do we overwrite or merge if an existing geo file is present ?
      Returns:
      the geo file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when writing the geo file
